author: Cindy G.
comment: (SPOILERS I think?) Isabella have a very deep past, she knows she went too far, she needs to sacrifice her children to survive long. She was lied as a child and her friend Leslie was the ones who made the Isabella's Lullaby, she says to Leslie to make the song he made as Isabella's Lullaby because she thinks it's a good idea. When she is getting shipped out/killed, Grandmother gave her a choice: Be the next mother, be a sister (like sister Krone) or die? Isabella found out her life was a lie and choose to be the next mother. She worked hard on the Grace Field, sacrificing her children to survive. When Ray sang her Lullaby, she gets a bit of flashbacks and she got back to her human self feeling bad. When Norman was getting shipped out, he said: Are you happy, mom? Isabella start to feel bad and go back to her human self for a while again. Yk when they escaped, she smiled because nobody have ever escaped from the Grace Field Farm. She still need to do it to survive so she did. She still works at Grace Field Farm sacrificing children from the Grace Field Farm. Poor Isabella, the real enemy is Grandmother and the demons. :(

author: Beany Gacha â€¢wâ€¢
comment: Somehow I feel like why Isabella tried so hard to keep the children from escaping was a feeling of neglect, she didnâ€™t want to think that these kids could do something that she could never do.  She didnâ€™t want to think that there was a way to actually escape and she just couldnâ€™t figure out how.  She really did love the kids, she wanted them to be happy but she also wanted to feel sure that there was no way she could be put in the real human world.  In the end, she realized that them completing something she could never do was better, and it was wrong to hold them back even though she was in the same situation at their age, so she cut the ropes as a last act of love for her kids. This is just my theory though

Why don't you run from me? What are you wondering? What do you know? Why aren't you scared of me? Why do you care for me? When we all fall asleep, where do we go?  Listen...  Keep you in the dark, what had you expected? Me to make you my art And make you a star and get you connected? I'll meet you in the park I'll be calm and collected But we knew right from the start That you'd fall apart 'cause I'm too expensive Your talk'll be somethin' that shouldn't be said out loud Honestly, I thought that I would be dead by now (Wow) Callin' security, keepin' my head held down Bury the hatchet or bury your friend right now  For the debt I owe, gotta sell my soul 'Cause I can't say no, no, I can't say no Then my limbs all froze and my eyes won't close And I can't say no, I can't say no  Careful...  Step on the glass, staple your tongue (Ahh-ha) Bury a friend, try to wake up (Ahh-ha) Cannibal class, killin' the son (Ahh) Bury a friend, I wanna end me  I wanna end me I wanna, I wanna, I wanna end me I wanna, I wanna, I wannaâ€“  What do you want from me? Why don't you run from me? What are you wondering? What do you know? Why aren't you scared of me? Why do you care for me? When we all fall asleep, where do we go?

author: CrÃ¸wned Kit
comment: Here's a few reasons why this fits and I love it. When Emma and Norman left Little Bunny (the bunny stuffed animal) at the place with the car or whatever its called and Isabella (the mom) found it, she knew *someone* found out about what they were doing, she immediately suspected Emma, Norman, or Ray, and the line in the song, 'what do you know', is so perfectly placed, because that was when Isabella was asking Emma is she was ok, and she wasn't her cheery self. And when it played 'honestly I thought that I'd be dead right now', young Isabella was being asked to become the next person to inherit the role as a mom, and there was a huge demon (I think their called). Then during around the beginning of the video, where Emma and Norman were chatting and walking down stairs and it played 'what are you wondering', Isabella was watching them. Anyway this was really cool, epic job :D

author: Eno P
comment: People keep saying Isabella is a good. I donâ€™t agree with that. Isabella is neither good nor bad. Sheâ€™s a victim of an evil system, and she did what she had to do to survive. Sheâ€™s a survivor, thatâ€™s all. Unlike Emma, who much rather die than become part of that system, Isabella thought first and foremost of herself and thatâ€™s why she lost her humanity along the way. She hasnâ€™t lost it completely because she felt glad the children escaped. However, sheâ€™s not good either. When the children escaped,they showed her another option and what you can accomplish if youâ€™re willing to sacrifice even your life to help others. Even as a child, Isabella tried to escape, it seems, but she was trying to do it by herself, again, showing the difference between her and Emma.I havenâ€™t read the manga, so I donâ€™t know if we will see more of her or not. I hope we do and see how this has affected her. I like this series because characters are not so black or white. You could literally talk on and on about these characters.ðŸ˜…

author: Siyeon ãƒ„
comment: bc she went through 10+ years of mental torture, an unwanted pregnancy, and forced competition with her peers in risk of becoming demon food...? she went through exactly what the children did and saw no hope outside of GF. To her, it was life or death. She broke Emma's leg because she thought all that waited for them outside the farms was a painful death. She wanted Ray's brain because she thought if any of the fullscores died, she would too, essentially making the remainder of her life uselessâ€”also, they were literally a DAY away from Ray's birthday, aka what Isabella had known for the past 12 years to be when he was going to be killed. Isabella had already accepted the fact that Ray was going to die, like she accepted the death of any of the other children (as creepy as that is, I can't find to hate her). Her threats to kill the children were obviously empty. She can't kill them. She'd be killed instead. It was her way of trying to scare the children into staying at GF.

author: Elizabeth Baronian
comment: I donâ€™t think Isabella is a bad guy. I think she was trying to survive by choosing the mom path. I think the creepiness she shows from having no emotion is from doing it for so long. I think she got desensitized after awhile. It was probably hard to raise kids that you knew were going to be killed by yourself in a few years. You can see in the last episode how she told them to be safe. In the end she wanted them to have what she couldnâ€™t. It is really sad actually and my theory in the second season is going to be she is gonna be a good guy more or less. I have a feeling she will probably not be able to do much since she canâ€™t leave the wall, so after her job is done (helping the little kids get out in anyway she can) she will probably die. Idk but my guess is she will either kill herself or get killed by whoever she works for.

author: Anima
comment: This was the best AMV I have ever seen. The song choice was perfect.    Starting from the beginning, aligning the clock with the sound really caught my attention an immediately made me drawn to this amv. There isn't too much movement so we get disorientated (I hate when people over-do it!) and the grey filter over it made the atmostphere fit and also allowed us to focus more on the emotions. You even timed the lyrics--I can't say no -- Isabella unable to say no because she'll die. It's the only path she can take. The fact that you timed the sounds from the anime and the song was just icing on the cake...it was incredible!! I have to say this is incredible, and I absolutely adore it!!

comment: I honestly think Isabelle was so hard on the kids when they tried to escape because if they survived and got away from her, they had a chance at surviving beyond the wall. That's why she smiled. She never wanted to pass on this curse, but she had no choice. So when they made it out, she thought, Finally, a chance. If she had just let them leave she would of been gotten rid of and the kids would of likely been to proud of themselves not to think of the threats and how worse the demons/monsters are. Now that they know how hard it was to escape from just a human, they will not undermined the demons/monsters.

author: Adam DR
comment: For being your first AMV this is seriously good. I really like AMVs but most are poorly edited and just slap action scenes and music like that meant to fit, but this one is really good. The first 7 seconds is a great hook and makes me want to watch more.    A few things I would suggest  1- I don't think cutting out the song completely from the video then putting normal speech in fits very well, like at 0:57. 2- I really like when the feeling of the song and feel of the clips match it creates an awesome music video that seems like it the original, it's even better when it tells a story or points out a theme in the anime that might not be so apparent.   3- Since it is your first AMV I would watch som other AMV  channels and get some ideas, personally I think oMuStIiA's channel creates some really great AMVs. I Recommend watching  Dollhouse from their channel for some ideas.    Overall a great Stand alone AMV and even a better first start, you earned yourself a sub and I look forward to seeing more of your content in the future.

author: BadLuck Nat
comment: Thanks for the tips! I watch A LOT of AMVs :DD , also i like when there are original sounds form the anime completing the song, and i dont think the spoken part would work during the singing. author: The Spell Alchemist
comment: I loved.   I loved my home.   I loved Leslie.  I lovedâ€¦.  I could stay strongâ€¦because I had that tune with me. I have no regrets. After all, this was the path I chose for myself. I can't change the world. What would my death do ? If anything, I need to make the best of what I do have. I must provide all of the love inside of me. I must let them live as long as possible. These children know nothing. He's no longer around.   I must live for myselfâ€¦to give purpose to Leslie's life.   I wanted to live longer than anybody else. I was unbelievably frustratedâ€¦to find out he had been killed. I can't do or change a single thing. And that's exactly whyâ€¦ I wanted to do the least I could doâ€¦to liveâ€¦as a human they COULDN'T EAT!   I suppose itâ€¦doesn't matter anymore.  This is my defeat  Those children have escaped.  I am now a useless keeper who couldn't protect her own goods. Just now, all of my efforts to reach the top have been utterly destroyed. No matter how hard I try to capture those children again, Iâ€¦  Perhaps if I had kept Krone aroundâ€¦ If I hadn't let Norman see the other side of the wall that dayâ€¦ The results may have been different.   No, it's useless to think of what ifs. In any case, it still remains true that I wasn't able to see through the growth of those children.  This is my defeat.  They were so smallâ€¦ All of themâ€¦used to beâ€¦so smallâ€¦  I wish I COULD have just LOVED them NORMALLY  Farewellâ€¦  Stay safe.  If the world will permit itâ€¦  I sincerely hope you all find a light at the end of the tunnel.
